Class Caesar

  • java.lang.Object
    • Caesar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RotationCipher
    public class Caesar
extends java.lang.Object
implements RotationCipher
    A class implementing the interface we made in RotationCipher. Caesar implemenets RotationCipher as Caesar is the subclass. In Caesar we have taken the methods from the interface and we have implemented them so that they now work. Throughout the project i focused on making the project as easy to use as possible. With the use of the public variables at the top which are easily distinguishable, and the knownFreq array. You can easily change your language.
    Version:
    JDK 11.0.1
    Author:
    Andrew Lawler

                               int n)
        Rotate This is the class responsible for rotating the string by n
        Specified by:
        rotate in interface RotationCipher
        Parameters:
        s - represents the String which is taken in, this is the string we want to rotate
        n - represents the rotation value
        Returns:
        we return the new string which has been rotated

      • decipher

        public java.lang.String decipher​(java.lang.String s)
        Decipher This method is completely responsibe for deciphering a string input. It first takes the string and rotates it for every possible rotation. It then compares the frequencies by sending them to the chiSquared method.
        Specified by:
        decipher in interface RotationCipher
        Parameters:
        s - represents the string taken in as an input, this string is then deciphered
        Returns:
        we simply return the deciphered string

      • frequencies

        public double[] frequencies​(java.lang.String s)
        frequencies This method is responsible for taking a string input and returning a double[] of its frequencies for every letter.
        Specified by:
        frequencies in interface RotationCipher
        Parameters:
        s - represents the String we take as an input (the string we are finding the frequencies for)
        Returns:
        returns the strings frequencies as a double[]

      • chiSquared

        public double chiSquared​(double[] letters,
                         double[] knownFreq)
        chiSquared This is the method which is responsible for taking the knownFreq array and the new frequencies array we just calculated. We compare letter by letter the frequencies array with the knownFreq array using a simple calculation. We then return the total given. Calculation in its raw format: ((frequencies[i]-Language[i])^2 / Language[i])
        Specified by:
        chiSquared in interface RotationCipher
        Parameters:
        letters - represents the frequencies array that was returned from the frequencies() method.
        knownFreq - represents the language frequencies for the language we are using. This was initialised in decipher()
        Returns:
        returns the total of the calculation for the set rotation
